VariableDescription.Name: efield_spinfit_mgse
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Spinfit E-field in MGSE (autoscale, VxB subtracted, i.e. near GSE)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         rbsp
#     SOURCE_NAME                     RBSPB>Van Allen Probes (RBSP) B
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DESCRIPTOR                      EFW-L2>Electric Field and Waves L2
#     DATA_VERSION                    01
#     PI_NAME                         J. R. Wygant
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  University of Minnesota
#     TEXT                            CDAWeb interface derived data on Fri Jun 14 15:33:16 EDT 2013. Contacts:  Tami.J.Kovalick@nasa.gov,    
#     TEXT                             Rita.C.Johnson@nasa.gov. Spinfit DC electric field estimates in the M-GSE coordinate                  
#     TEXT                             system - see the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for a description                   
#     TEXT                             of the spin fit algorithm and the M-GSE coordinate system. One 2D vector estimate                     
#     TEXT                             of the E-field is computed at a cadence of once per spin period (typ. 10.7                            
#     TEXT                             to 11.1 s) using the survey E-field data product - the potential difference                           
#     TEXT                             between EFW sensors V1 and V2 (E12) sampled at a nominal rate of 32 samp/s                            
#     TEXT                             with a resolution of 16 bits. The X-component of the E-field estimate, corresponding                  
#     TEXT                             to the axial component in the spacecraft coordinate system, is set to zero                            
#     TEXT                             in this data product.  See the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html)                       
#     TEXT                             for a discussion of this convention for this data product. The VxB electric                           
#     TEXT                             field in the spacecraft frame due to orbital motion of the spacecraft around                          
#     TEXT                             the Earth as computed from the spacecraft orbital velocity and measured B-field                       
#     TEXT                             in the spacraft frame has been subtracted from the measured electric field,                           
#     TEXT                             and so the data product is in the quasi-inertial frame equivalent to GSE (i.e.                        
#     TEXT                             it is NOT in the corotation frame of the Earth!). Each spin fit is time-tagged                        
#     TEXT                             with the time corresponding to the middle of the spin of data that went into                          
#     TEXT                             the spin fit algorithm; in other words, if a given spin covers the interval                           
#     TEXT                             [t1, t2), then the spin fit E-field estimate associated with that spin is given                       
#     TEXT                             the time tag 0.5*(t1 + t2). The root mean square residual between the data                            
#     TEXT                             included in the fit and the resulting best-fit model, sigma, and the final                            
#     TEXT                             number of points included in the spin fit, npts, are also provided at spin-period                     
#     TEXT                             cadence. The nominal dynamic range of the E-field estimate is +/- 1 V/m in                            
#                                      any component.                                                                                        
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Electric Fields (space)
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Van Allen Probes (RBSP)
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  rbspb_efw-l2_e-spinfit-mgse
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Spinfit (10.9 sec resolution) DC Electric Field estimates in M-GSE coordinates.
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 UTC
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Open Data for Scientific Use; please see EFW "Rules of the Road" (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/data_policy
#     RULES_OF_USE                     for details of the Van Allen Probes Mission and EFW Instrument "Rules of the                          
#     RULES_OF_USE                     Road", and the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for details                           
#                                      of and caveats on instrument performance and data quality.                                            
#     GENERATED_BY                    RBSP-EFW SOC
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 This work was supported by Van Allen Probes (RBSP) EFW funding provided by JHU/APL                     
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                  Contract No. TBD under NASA's Prime Contract No. TBD; EFW PI, J. R. Wygant,                           
#                                      UMN.                                                                                                  
#     MODS                            v01:  initial version.
#     ADID_REF                        n/a
#     LINK_TEXT                       EFW home page at Minnesota with
#                                     Van Allen Probes
#     LINK_TITLE                      Daily Summary Plots and additional L2 data
#                                     Science Gateway (including Mission Rules of the Road for Data Usage)
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://rbsp.space.umn.edu
#                                     http://rbspgway.jhuapl.edu/
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_descriptor_datatype
#     DATA_TYPE                       e-spinfit-mgse>Spinfit DC Electric Field in M-GSE Coordinates
#     GENERATION_DATE                 Fiducial UTC YYYY:MM:DDTHH:MM:SS (NOTE:  to be filled in by the L2 generation                          
#                                      process prior to final write).                                                                        
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 rbspb_efw-l2_e-spinfit-mgse_00000000_v01
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time, UTC
#  2. Spinfit E-field in MGSE (autoscale, VxB subtracted, i.e. near GSE)
#       NOTES:  Spin-fit electric field esimate in the MGSE coordinate system and GSE frame (VxB subtracted) derived from the EFW e12 (V1-V2) data product.
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 18:01:53 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#
TIME,_UTC                                                EX_VXBSUB_MGSE                      EY_VXBSUB_MGSE                      EZ_VXBSUB_MGSE
                                                                 (@_1_)                              (@_2_)                              (@_3_)
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mil.mic.nan.pic                                mV/m                                mV/m                                mV/m
05-09-2012 23:21:46.733.086.000.000                        -1.00000E+31                                 NaN                                 NaN

VariableDescription.Name: efield_spinfit_mgse_fixedscale
VariableDescription.LongDescription: ---> Spinfit E-field in MGSE (fixedscale, VxB subtracted, i.e. near GSE)

#     TEXT                             it is NOT in the corotation frame of the Earth!). Each spin fit is time-tagged                        
#     TEXT                             with the time corresponding to the middle of the spin of data that went into                          
#     TEXT                             the spin fit algorithm; in other words, if a given spin covers the interval

#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 UTC

#     RULES_OF_USE                     Road", and the EFW-FAQ (http://rbsp.space.umn.edu/efw_faq.html) for details

#     TEXT                             of the spin fit algorithm and the M-GSE coordinate system. One 2D vector estimate                     
#     TEXT                             of the E-field is computed at a cadence of once per spin period (typ. 10.7                            
#     TEXT                             to 11.1 s) using the survey E-field data product - the potential difference

VariableDescription.Name: e_spinfit_mgse_efw_qual
VariableDescription.LongDescription: EFW quality array (global estimate of EFW data quality, plus 13 underlying observatory and instrument-level data quality factors)
VariableDescription.Header:
